title: : : : A Prayer In Type . ID HELP : : :
content:
Blessings of the Masses  
+  
Blessings of the State  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

with humility in heart and typography in mind.  
time and time again i return to typophile seeking  
the collective wisdom and knowledge which i’ve  
come know and depend upon.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

i have for your consideration two typographic compositions .  
both from japanese publications . i’ve just returned from work in tokyo  
and it never ceases to amaze me how much good Roman/Latin Character  
typography i see in a land built from kanji.

the first image is from a japanese magazine . DUNE .

the titling typeface is familiar . bringing to mind thoughts of NOFRET . FIRENZE . CALIFORNIAN .

it is however distinct . CAN ANYONE NAME THIS . POSITIVELY ? ? ? ?

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

the second image is from a new NTT DOCOMO campaign .  
i believe the type is an illustration. but i wanted to show everyone  
here . and ask if anyone could recommend a similar style san-serif,  
with angular finishes + details .

+  
+  
+

my sincerest sentiments & well wishes for a powerful 2006 .

+  
+  
+

hold me down . holy .

Aerosyn-Lex Mestrovic .

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Type\_Specimen\_I.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630/http:/typophile.com/files/Type_Specimen_I.jpg) | 130.47 KB |
| [Type\_Specimen\_II.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630/http:/typophile.com/files/Type_Specimen_II.jpg) | 77.18 KB |
author: Aerosyn-Lex Mes...

comments.content:
A SINCERE REQUEST FOR HELP . . .

i’d like to ask again . if anyone can positively identify the type in use in the FIRST SPECIMEN .

.

the second image is more than likely an illustration . or custom type for the ad .

so disregard that .

but i’m dying to know what font is in play in the first image .

please please please . lend any and all advice .

.

Peace Be Unto You .

.

Hold Me Down Holy .

.

Aeroysn-Lex Mestrovic

. : : : S A N G R E . P A G A . P A R A . S A N G R E : : : .

Sorry I missed this when you first posted it.

The first one appears to be Andrich Minerva, an old VGC film font:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/andrich-minerva.gif)

The R is different, but otherwise it matches.

I don’t know of a digital version.

About the sans serif — the vector structure reminds me of [Emigre](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Emigre)’s classic [Citizen](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=E.561.0.0) by [Zuzana Licko](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Zuzana%252BLicko), though the character shapes don’t match.

Andrich Minerva somewhat resembles [Gustav F. Schroeder](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Gustav%252BF.%252BSchroeder)’s [DeVinne](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=BT.791.0.0) (also available in [Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=BT.792.0.0) variant). I don’t know if that’s close enough for you.

as always . my unending thanks + praise  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Andrich Minerva is a gorgeous typeface .

Mark, may i ask where you referenced that image . is it in your personal collection ?

Also, you mentioned you don’t know of a digital version . is there anything SIMILAR

which you would be able to recommend ? ? ?

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

CITIZEN immediately came to mind . the genius work of Zuzana Licko .

i thought it might be a reference for the illustration .

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

thank you again for the support .

DeVinne seems to have more of an | Engravers Feel | to it .

If any other similar fonts come to mind . please please do not hesitate

to post \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Peace.Be.With.You.

Aerosyn-Lex

. : : : S A N G R E . P A G A . P A R A . S A N G R E : : : .

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=scotch+roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=scotch+roman "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=scotch+roman")

A similar font the R is still different and the x-height isn’t quite as much.  
I wonder if a background colour stroke has been applied to the text.  
Tim

The sample of Andrich Minerva came from a photo display type catalog from around 1980. The font was published by VGC. It was one of the winners of a type design contest they held in 1965. I suspect your sample is pre-digital.

As for similar fonts, it reminds me of [ITC Century Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=ITC.119123.0.0) and [ITC Modern 216 Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=EF.929.0.0).

MY THANKS TO ALL . for the insightful replies .  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

I still hope to find the exact typeface in use . The sample

comes from a modern monthly japanese magazine, using the

face throughout each issue as well as for the title design.

I’m thinking it may be a custom font . So I have written the

Art Director in hopes of learning exactly what typeface it is .

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

ITC Modern 216 Light is a gorgeous typeface in it’s own right .

it has many of the same nuances as ANDRICH MINERVA .

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

thank you for all the help .

PEACE BE

Aerosyn-Lex Mestrovic

. : : : S A N G R E . P A G A . P A R A . S A N G R E : : : .

A digital version of Andrich Minerva was released by [Image Club](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Image%252BClub) in 1989 and subsequently revised several times during the early 90s. The face was discontinued for quality and consistency reasons in 1998 when Image Club was still part of [Adobe](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Adobe).

Since it was discontinued and Agfa not longer distributes the family as part of [the current Image Club library](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/searchresults.htm?st=5&cid=Image+Club), the only place that Andrich Minerva is still available is on an old copy of the Image Club LetterPress disc. I believe I still have a couple of lightly-used copies of this disc, if you are interested in obtaining one.

Here are a couple of samples set in Image Club’s Andrich Minerva using the text from your image. As you can see, the cap ’R’ is different and the kerning is fairly ugly.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/andrich1.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090925023630im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/andrich2.gif)
